Single-stage laryngotracheal reconstruction.
 The mainstay for repairing subglottic and tracheal stenosis has been the rib graft with prolonged stenting.
 A refinement of this treatment was the use of the anterior cricoid decompression (split).
 We present single-stage reconstruction of the airway as an additional refinement of the laryngotracheoplasty.
 This article describes the experience of two institutions with single-stage reconstruction and offers some observations on the principles of the technique.
